newsitem.title: USA: Hollinger Q4 net hurt by UK prepaid plan.
newsitem.headline: Hollinger Q4 net hurt by UK prepaid plan.

text.p: Hollinger International Inc said on Wednesday its fourth quarter financial results for 1996 were hurt by costs of a special direct, prepaid subscription plan in the United Kingdom.

Hollister's Telegraph newspaper for the first time offered prepaid subscriptions to its readers, who formerly dealt directly with independent news agents. To gain acceptance, the new plan initially was offered at a loss, but the company said prices will be increased to make the plan profitable by the end of the year.
A one-time charge of $32.3 million was recorded as a result. Net revenue per share, including the charge, was $0.25 for the quarter, compared to a loss of $0.13 for the same quarter in 1995.
